data.title: adds fallbacks to the aiTurret's scannode to operate similar to the aimNode
data.body: lets folks skip out on adding either and just using pitch (or failing that, heading)

data.title: Enables SDL's ability to drag and drop files onto the game window
data.body: Enables SDL's ability to drag and drop files onto the game window and have it call back into script for handling.

data.title: Adds some filtering options to the console log gui
data.body: Adds some filtering options to the console log gui so you can specify if you wish to be able to see errors, warnings and regular messages. It also denotes how many errors and warnings are currently in the log.

data.title: Updates the VariableInspector, VariableGroup and VariableField objects
data.body:
Updates the VariableInspector, VariableGroup and VariableField objects to actually be useful. In addition to the original functionality of being able to have a var name passed in and search for all vars with that in it, it also lets you build out a completely custom Inspector.

Unlike the regular Inspector, which requires a specific object or objects, from which the fields are pulled from, this lets you manually create fields, which can tie into any given object and their fields, global vars, and also not only supports the engine types for fields, but also triggers a callback to script if a field type is not found allowing fully custom fields to be handled as needed.

data.title: Initial implementation of the EditorTool class and world editor hook-in.
Sets the default grid snap size to 1 rather than 10.
data.body: Sets the default grid snap size to 1 rather than 10. 1 Seems like a more neutral default value, and also makes it match the displayed '1' in the UI interface as the default as well.

data.title: textureProfile conflict reporting
data.body: from@rextimmy: reports the same texture used with 2 conflicting textureProfiles (flipping back and forth causes duplicates)

data.title: Soldier and weapon DAE load times
data.body:
As part of my now probably tiresome ranting mutterings about the DAE files supplied with the full template, I ran a test.
In debug, it took a full 3 mins 50 seconds to load the empty mission.
In release, it took 20 seconds.

@dottools explained that the system was due to the possibility of the changing DTS format and making sure that the internal assets were up to date with that format

While this particular reasoning I believe requires some other thought, it made me wonder exactly what the debug build is doing that the release isn't with this data especially since the time taken is over 10x as long. If somebody had a project that had say 10x as many assets (not really a stretch with even an indie game) or even more; then the time it would take to regenerate dts files from dae files would be astronomical in debug builds. While I understand that this is a rarity and in real terms should only need to be run once but still, its a potential huge wait.

data.title: object snap to terrain
data.body:
Sounds a little captain obvious, but this doesnt snap an object to a ground plane.

Given that a groundplane may be used in lieu of a terrain object, perhaps this issue should be considered

data.title: Sanity check to ensure detail levels shift in tandem for skinned meshes
Tempate cleanup
data.body:
Extra files not needed or that overwrite cmake created files.

main.cs overwrites the created one and renames the 'appname' to full if thats the template you use

the cleanup files delete*. are replaced completely by a single cleanup file by the cmake process.

It is also reasonable to assume that with the removal of DX9 nobody will be using the older project generator and older solution files and should be using cmake anyway, this makes the buildfiles folder redundant also.

data.title: Standardizes gui controls that load bitmaps to use GFXTexturePersiste…
data.body: …ntSRGBProfile and removes GFXGuiCursorProfile and GFXDefaultGUIProfile

data.title: Fixes smCommonShaderPath init order
data.body:
Moves the initialization of the shader common path const var so it is set before we do an initial setup of some shadergen fields.

Resolves #2079

data.title: Shader include path bug in BaseGame template.
data.body:
Today I tried to compile T3D with the BaseGame template, after i hit the “Launch World Editor” button, some errors occurred. Some  dialogs popped with the info "Failed to open the include 'shaders/common/torque.hlsl'". i think this is a path bug, may be the developers forgot to update the include file path in some shader files, casue the "torque.hlsl" is no longer in the "shaders/common" path but in the "shaders/" path in the BaseGame template.

Here is the post in the forum with  screenshots. Hope that  helps .

This also fixes #1666

data.title: allows different waypoints
data.body:
I wanted to share this for some time, not sure if this is the best way to do it, but before it falls into the void :) this will allows to have at the same time different waypoint/markers, add more "WayPointMarker"....

Well you could always add from script, but this PR allows to add it from the World Editor.

See an example, at the right the green old shape. Now you can have different shapes and colors used for enemies, allies, objects.... I can do other PR with the markers I use, it have different shapes and colors, if required.

![markers](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1057449/29991497-96c010aa-8f4d-11e7-9d28-f5b5f08c36a6.png)

![markers2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1057449/29991651-8de9e282-8f50-11e7-91a2-0d2836df54c7.png)

data.title: sqlite fixes
data.body:
This fixes numerous issues with the sqlite code:

* STDLIB.H include file, contains capitals and doesn't compile on linux or macOS. We should also prefer the c++ header version which is cstdlib
* The SQLiteObject.cc should be named SQLiteObject.cpp
* The sqlite source code is placed in the t3d source directory, external libs should only ever live in the 'lib' directory
* Converted numerous int to S32 types.

Edit:
Just noticed there are actually heaps of other whitespace issues with the original code, i missed most of those with this PR :/

data.title: from @Azaezel: fixes flaws found with openvr in production
Establish proper fix for #2072
data.body: While #2072 fixes the issue, it's basically a hack workaround. Properly correcting the underlying behavior would be preferential to ensure stability(as well as help future-proof against any other odd compiler behavior crops up in the future)

data.title: Hotfix to make VS2017 15.3 play nice.
data.body: Hotfix to make VS2017 15.3 play nice. Offsetof behavior - specifically builtin - is unreliable in release(and broken in debug), so explicitly defining it to use a reliable method for now.

data.title: Moon shrinks on zooming in
data.body:
If you set your scatterSky to night a moon billboard object will appear, the problem with the moon is, it stays the same size, if you use the right click zoom on it making it look like the moon shrinks.
This should not happen I think.

data.title: Support for VS 15.3 update
data.body: Unfortunately Microsoft have told us big fat lies and that the template bug would be fixed with update 15.3(msc_ver 1911)but it hasn't been fixed. This leaves us with little choice for now but to do a _MSC_VER >= 1910 until this problem is resolved and we know exactly what versions numbers we are dealing with.

data.body: This fixes a potential crash with D3D11 that usually happens when playing a video or displaying a splash screen and resizing the window
